result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were revoked, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant William J Murray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A", Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: SEE CONDITIONS AS INDICATED ON DEFERRED ADJUDICATION AGREEMENT.

supervisions.notes: If revoked, Defendant entitled to 13 days credit.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.

Undertake AODA assessment and  comply with treatment recommendations.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive to any previously imposed sentence.   No good time.  No credit.  Jail term can be served in Milwaukee County if arrangements can be made.   Huber granted if in compliance with jail facility regulations.  Defendant shall report, IN PERSON, to the Winnebago County Jail, Work Release Unit, WITHIN 72 HOURS, after sentencing with a completed GPS application and to arrange a report date.  Failure to report to jail/huber shall result in loss of work release privileges and a warrant shall be authorized.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
